text: The San Luis Rey River is a river in the southern part of the U.S. state of California. It begins in the Cleveland National Forest, near a mountain called Palomar Mountain, in several forks. It flows south into a reservoir, called Lake Henshaw. It then turns west and flows to its mouth at the Pacific Ocean. Altogether, it is about long. Its watershed covers an area of 562 square miles. The lower part of the river is polluted, but the water in the upper part of the river can be used for drinking water. ==Nearby rivers== ===North along coast=== * Santa Margarita River ===South along coast=== * San Diego River Category:Rivers of California Category:San Diego County, California
title: San Luis Rey River
